decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa by using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. It also includes control elements like Prismatic Ending and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game by assembling the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate huge amounts of mana to cast powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It also includes various control elements such as All Is Dust, Dismember, and Oblivion Stone to control the board state. The deck uses cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find the UrzaTron lands efficiently, while also providing card selection with Ancient Stirrings. Overall, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Grief and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Liliana of the Veil, while also utilizing cards like The Rack to chip away at the opponent's life total. Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for artifacts that can further enhance the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck combines disruption, aggression, and resource management to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while rapidly progressing towards a win condition. Utilizing efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Counterspell, and Murktide Regent, alongside aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure. By leveraging card advantage from cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure a victory through swift and calculated plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with multiple colors to maximize the effectiveness of Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact. By having cards like Scion of Draco and Territorial Kavu in the deck, you can deal significant damage to your opponent quickly. The inclusion of Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Stubborn Denial helps with card advantage and protecting your creatures. With the help of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, you can further enhance your aggro strategy and overwhelm your opponent with a fast and powerful assault.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of options that can be searched for and brought into play using cards like Chord of Calling. The key strategy involves assembling powerful combinations of creatures to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes combo pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate value and close out games quickly. The deck aims to be flexible and adapt to various situations by utilizing a diverse array of creature abilities.

This Elemental aggro deck focuses on leveraging the synergy between Elemental creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. Cards like Risen Reef and Omnath, Locus of Creation generate value and provide a strong presence on the battlefield, while spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending offer removal options. Wrenn and Six provide additional value by recurring lands and other spells, while Leyline Binding helps to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also includes companions Kaheera, the Orphanguard for additional synergy with Elemental creatures. Overall, the key idea is to build a fast and versatile aggro strategy with Elementals.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox effect, allowing for flexibility in different situations. By using cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Chord of Calling, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combos and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Orcish Bowmasters, Zulaport Cutthroat, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse adds additional utility and win conditions. The land base is carefully crafted to support the creature toolbox strategy and ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay utilizing creatures with high power and using Leyline cards to control the field. The deck also includes various lands to support the mana base, allowing for consistent casting of spells. With the inclusion of Jegantha as a companion, the deck can take advantage of its mana cost restrictions to further enhance its gameplay strategy. The key strategy revolves around quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Hardened Scales card to boost the +1/+1 counters on creatures, primarily Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista. The strategy revolves around quickly creating a board presence with efficient creatures like Hangarback Walker and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp, while also utilizing support cards like Animation Module and The Ozolith. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and potent synergy between cards that benefit from the accumulation of counters. Its aggressive playstyle aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.
